title: The unexpected math behind Van Gogh's "Starry Night" - Natalya St. Clair

options.label: B
options.text: Work that visually communicates meaning beyond language

options.label: C

options.text: The art is experienced in a drastically removed context from its original intention

options.label: B
options.text: It allows viewers to consider the art in terms of a common theme

options.text: It allows viewers to appreciate the art solely for its technical skill

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential outcome of considering art from different times and places as part of a unified whole of past human experience?

title: How to choose your news - Damon Brown

multiple-choice.question: How has the availability of information changed over the past few decades?

options.label: A
options.text: The amount of information available has decreased.

options.label: B
options.text: The amount of information available has remained the same.

options.label: C
options.text: The amount of information available has increased, but only through traditional media sources.

options.label: D
options.text: The amount of information available has increased exponentially with the advent of the internet.

multiple-choice.question: What was a major problem with the traditional media system of the past?

options.label: A
options.text: There were too many sources of information.

options.label: B
options.text: The public had too much control over the information they received.

options.label: C
options.text: Democratic governments and media outlets often misled the public.

options.label: D
options.text: There were not enough newscasters delivering the news.

multiple-choice.question: What has been the result of the breakdown of trust in traditional media gatekeepers?

options.label: A
options.text: A decrease in alternative news sources.

options.label: B
options.text: An increase in alternative news sources, such as alternative newspapers and online blogs.

options.label: C
options.text: A complete elimination of traditional media sources.

options.label: D
options.text: A decrease in the amount of information available to the public.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to get original news unfiltered by middlemen?

options.label: A
options.text: So that you can rely solely on the opinions of others.

options.label: B
options.text: So that you can get the truth, or something close to it, without interpretation.

options.label: C
options.text: So that you can avoid reading scientific studies or politician's speeches.

options.label: D
options.text: So that you can only follow reporters on social media.

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential drawback of following major events in real-time?

options.label: A
options.text: You may get the most up-to-date information.

options.label: B
options.text: You may be able to follow the event from multiple perspectives.

options.label: C
options.text: You may be exposed to incorrect information or false accusations.

options.label: D
options.text: You may only get information from traditional media sources.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it crucial to separate fact from opinion when consuming news?

options.label: A
options.text: So that you can form your own opinions.

options.label: B
options.text: So that you can rely solely on the opinions of others.

options.label: C
options.text: So that you can identify biases and inaccuracies in reporting.

options.label: D
options.text: So that you can avoid reading news articles altogether.

multiple-choice.question: What should you do before sharing a news item on social media?

options.label: A
options.text: Share it immediately without verifying it.

options.label: B
options.text: Verify the news item through a web search and consider multiple sources.

options.label: C
options.text: Only share news items from traditional media sources.

options.label: D
options.text: Only share news items that align with your personal opinions.

multiple-choice.question: What is one way to identify potential biases in news reporting?

options.label: B
options.text: Only read news articles from traditional media sources.

options.label: C
options.text: Avoid reading news articles that present multiple perspectives.

options.label: D
options.text: Only follow reporters on social media.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to be cautious of reports that rely on anonymous sources?

options.label: B
options.text: Anonymous sources may have little connection to the story or have an interest in influencing coverage.

options.label: C
options.text: Anonymous sources are only used in traditional media sources.

options.label: D
options.text: Anonymous sources are only used in alternative news sources.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate responsibility of individuals in the modern media landscape?

options.label: A
options.text: To rely solely on traditional media gatekeepers.

options.label: B
options.text: To curate their own experience and ensure that the flow of information does not become overwhelming.

options.label: C
options.text: To only consume news from alternative sources.
